title: Former Brookline firefighter whose legal battle put a spotlight on racial discrimination has died
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News “Gerald Alston was a courageous and selfless firefighter who never gave up in his fight for justice and fairness.
” Former Brookline firefighter Gerald Alston addresses supporters at a rally outside Brookline Town Hall in 2021.
Pat Greenhouse/Boston Globe Staff, File By Abby Patkin November 14, 2025 | 3:04 PM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Man dead after being struck by BMW in Georgetown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The driver remained at the scene, according to officials.
By Abby Patkin November 14, 2025 | 1:45 PM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A pedestrian was struck and killed by a BMW in Georgetown Thursday evening, according to officials.

title: Red Sox pitchers Garrett Crochet, Aroldis Chapman named to All-MLB first team
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The two left-handers headed the Red Sox bullpen in 2025 on the way to their playoff birth.
Aroldis Chapman celebrates a win over the Yankees in game 1 of the Wild Card round (Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff).
While the Red Sox‘ playoff run didn’t go as hoped, that didn’t prevent a pair of their best players from receiving a top honor.

title: ‘The public needs to wake up’: Rhode Island mom detained at Logan for more than a week
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The woman, a legal permanent resident for 40 years, is being denied access to a lawyer while being held by Customs and Border Protection.
Green card holders traveling back to the US have been detained for extended periods of time within the airport by federal officials.
Charles Krupa/AP ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Stefon Diggs, Cardi B welcome baby boy as Patriots wide receiver puts up strong performance vs. Jets
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The announcement came during the Patriots' win over the Jets on Thursday.
Stefon Diggs and Cardi B went public with their relationship earlier this year.

(Photo by Elsa/Getty Images) By Conor Roche November 14, 2025 | 12:16 PM 1 minute to read Stefon Diggs had himself another strong performance in the Patriots’ win over the Jets on Thursday night, which apparently came on the heels of him receiving some good news off the field.

title: Northeastern, Boston strike landmark agreements on PILOT and campus expansion
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News “Boston thrives when our leading institutions match their global reach with a deep commitment to our neighborhoods,” Mayor Michelle Wu said in a statement.

Rodrique Ngowi / AP, File Boston and Northeastern University struck “landmark” agreements Thursday that clear the way for a major campus overhaul — including the redevelopment of Matthews Arena — and secure more than $130 million in payments and community benefits.
The new Institutional Master Plan includes $62.
